Trust only your own leaders. Trust them.
And be wise.
Question everything.
Be wise. Question everything.
Question leaders. Don't follow people blindly.
You can put your trust in them. Sure, but at the same time you have to be wise.
Be wise to question them. Be wise to try and understand their decisions.
Be wise enough to disobey them.
Should they choose to lead in a manner that is detrimental to the mission.
And to common sense. And you know what? You got to be wise.
Not just about your leaders, but not everyone.
Seek to understand people.
Which you do by watching and by observing them and by listening them.
And you know, we spend a lot of time on output.
We are sending all the time. We are talking all the time.
We are putting information out all the time.
Learn to be on receive load a little bit more. Learn to listen a little bit more. Learn to capture and absorb and utilize what other people reveal.
And when you do that, you'll garner a better understanding of them, of yourself, of the team, of your enemy, the nature of the battle itself, and the nature of humans.
So listen and learn and understand so that you can become wise.
And if you become wise, then you can win.
